title: Can one individual garnish another individuals wages?
question: my now ex boyfriend paid my rent for 8 months, nothing in writing, he never said a specific time to pay him back or even pay him back, we broke up and then he demanded the money back and is now threating me with garninshing my wages is this possible?
answers:
Yes, but first they have to sue you and win a judgment. Garnishing wages is one of the ways of enforcing a judgment.

It doesn't matter if there was nothing in writing if there was an oral contract to repay the rent payments. If you argue that the rent payments wre a gift, then it will be your word against his, if he claims that it was a loan that you agreed to repay. As for when repayment was due and when you breached, your ex thinks that time has passed, and while a judge won't enforce a contract that's too vague, they will impute a reasonable term if one's missing, and your ex may succeed in persuading the judge that the time to repay the money has come and gone.

Before anyone can garnish your wages (and, yes, it can be an individual), they have to go to court and get a judgment against you. In this case, he will have to show that his payment of the rent was a loan and that you promised to repay that. This is difficult to do if there is no written document but if there are witnesses who corroborate his version or if you ever said this to anyone else (an admission), he may be able to succeed. But can he get your wages garnished simply by saying he is going to? No.

Sorry this happened to you. Breakups are never fun and this kind of fighting and those kind of threats just make it worse. Good luck!
